definition: to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: The Ecraft workh element of Taurus can leadvertisement to strength mainly because well mainly because desire for solid ground form and structure.
sentences.chinese: 土相星座的特質讓金牛座祈望並具有腳踏實地的能力。

sentences.english: The Earth element of Taurus brings strength and the desire for solid ground form. and structure.
sentences.chinese: 土相星座的特質讓金牛座渴望並具有腳踏實地的能力。

sentences.english: Thank god this thug has finally come back down to earth.
sentences.chinese: 感謝上帝，這狂徒終於腳踏實地。

sentences.english: If you keep your feet firmly on the ground you'll have trouble putting on your pants.
sentences.chinese: 茹果你始終腳踏實地，那酵別想穿褲子了。

sentences.english: Solving practical problems is more important than just sitting with ideal.
sentences.chinese: 腳踏實地解決問題比空懷理想坐着不動重要。

sentences.english: In the study, I stand on solid ground, truth-seeking and innovation.
sentences.chinese: 學習中，我腳踏實地，求實創新。

sentences.english: Have ambition at everywhere and not idealistic and not practical, stand on solid ground but challenge extreme limit again.
sentences.chinese: 志在四方又不好高騖遠，腳踏實地而又挑戰極限。

sentences.english: We can't always have our head in the cloud, we need to be down-to-earth.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能總是那麼好高騖遠，我們要腳踏實地。

sentences.english: Americans use another expression that is similar in some ways to "down-to-earth. " The expression is "both feet on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 美國人用另一個表達實在人的方式叫“腳踏實地”的。

sentences.english: You’re methodical, practical and down to earth.
sentences.chinese: 有方法，重實際，腳踏實地。

sentences.english: And he had a very down-to-earth approach which really always impresses me.
sentences.chinese: 而最讓我印象深刻的是他腳踏實地的做事方法。

sentences.english: If that doesn’t keep your feet on the ground, what would?
sentences.chinese: 如果這樣不能讓你腳踏實地，還有什麼事情可以？

sentences.english: People should be down-to-earth, instead of being over-ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 做人應該腳踏實地，不要好高騖遠。

sentences.english: Down to earth, even at 29,000 feet.
sentences.chinese: 腳踏實地，即使在29，000英尺的高度。

sentences.english: I want you to really work at it.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你腳踏實地地去做。

definition: firmly-based/steady/steadfast/to have peace of mind/free from anxiety/Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in
at home wherever one is (idiom); ready to adapt/flexible/to accept circumstances with good will
to show initiative/to be a go-getter/to push forward with one's agenda
to strive one's hardest/to spare no effort
